name: _Group_Tool_Executor

content:
## Prerequisites for "ChatGPT for Business: A Comprehensive Guide to Professional Proficiency"

### Required Knowledge and Experience

- **General Business Acumen:**  
  Participants should possess a foundational understanding of business operations, including familiarity with common workflows such as email communication, report generation, and meeting management. This ensures relevance and immediate applicability of course content.

- **Digital Literacy:**  
  Basic proficiency in using web-based applications, navigating user interfaces, and managing files (uploading, downloading, organizing) is necessary. Participants should be comfortable with standard productivity tools (e.g., Microsoft Office, Google Workspace).

- **No Prior Coding or AI Expertise Required:**  
  The course is designed for non-technical professionals. No programming or advanced AI knowledge is assumed.

- **Interest in Process Improvement and Innovation:**  
  Participants should be open to adopting new technologies and exploring ways to enhance efficiency and productivity within their business context.

### Recommended (but Not Mandatory) Background

- **Experience with Collaboration Tools:**  
  Familiarity with platforms such as Slack, Microsoft Teams, or project management tools (e.g., Trello, Asana) will facilitate understanding of integration scenarios.

- **Exposure to Automation Concepts:**  
  While not required, prior exposure to basic automation (e.g., using rules in email clients or simple workflow automations in tools like Zapier) will accelerate learning in advanced modules.

### Prerequisite Resources

To ensure all participants are adequately prepared, the following resources are recommended for pre-course review:

#### Articles
- ["What is ChatGPT and How Does It Work?" (OpenAI Blog)](https://openai.com/blog/chatgpt)
- ["AI in Business: Key Concepts and Use Cases" (Harvard Business Review)](https://hbr.org/2023/01/how-to-use-ai-in-business)

#### Videos
- [OpenAI’s ChatGPT: An Introduction (YouTube, 8 min)](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=JTxsNm9IdYU)
- [How to Use ChatGPT for Everyday Business Tasks (YouTube, 12 min)](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=2FeymQoKvrk)

#### Tutorials
- [Getting Started with ChatGPT (OpenAI Help Center)](https://help.openai.com/en/articles/6783457-chatgpt-general-faq)
- [Zapier’s Beginner Guide to No-Code Automation](https://zapier.com/learn/automation/)

#### Optional Reading
- ["Responsible AI: Principles and Best Practices" (Microsoft Responsible AI Resource Center)](https://www.microsoft.com/en-us/ai/responsible-ai-resources)
- ["Prompt Engineering Guide" (PromptingGuide.ai)](https://www.promptingguide.ai/)

### Summary Table

| Prerequisite Area         | Required | Recommended | Resource Link/Type                |
|--------------------------|----------|-------------|-----------------------------------|
| Business Operations      | Yes      |             | -                                 |
| Digital Literacy         | Yes      |             | -                                 |
| Coding/AI Knowledge      |          |             | -                                 |
| Collaboration Tools      |          | Yes         | -                                 |
| Automation Concepts      |          | Yes         | Zapier Guide                      |
| ChatGPT Familiarity      |          | Yes         | OpenAI Blog, YouTube Intro        |
| Responsible AI Awareness |          | Yes         | Microsoft Responsible AI Resource |

---

**Participants are encouraged to review the above resources prior to the course to ensure a common baseline and maximize the value of hands-on activities and advanced modules.**

- **Exposure to Automation Concepts:**
